mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Clarysville Hospital. Civil War Records of Samuel West, Physician
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Patient Record for Wall, William
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Patient Name: Wall, William Patient Age: 28. Marital Status: Single. Diagnosis: Gun shot flesh wound right arm. Ball entered at the junction of the middle and upper third of [several words illegible] the humerus. Second ball entered 1 1/2 inches below the head of humerus anterior aspect. Exit at the [illegible] angle of the scapula. Third entered at the posterior border of the axilla. Passed out at the interior border of latissimus dorsi. . Location Wounded: Near Winchester, Va. Date Wounded: 1864/05/15 Wagon Train. Nature of Wound: Conical balls, pistol. Result: Discharged from service.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Wall, William

Gun shot flesh wound right arm. Ball entered at the junction of the middle and upper third of [several words illegible] the humerus. Second ball entered 1 1/2 inches below the head of humerus anterior aspect. Exit at the [illegible] angle of the scapula. Third entered at the posterior border of the axilla. Passed out at the interior border of latissimus dorsi.
Sergeant
K
1 NY Lincoln Cavalry [1st New York "Lincoln" Calvary]
England
Hospital Number 4448
